ResponseText: My aunt lives in Canada and she tells me the system is ok for "basic" health related problems. That means if you are going to need a transplant, etc it's just better to come to the states. I think socialized medical care might work for smaller countries, but for a country this size? I don't think it would be a viable solution. I think a tax incentive would be a better solution (like get insurance and we'll cut some of your taxes out) for the older folks and children I think medi-cal medicare is ok.

QuoteText: veterinary science requires broadly similar grades, but longer training. This makes sense because you need to be able to perform pretty much all the same procedures as a doctor, but be able to do them on everything from a coy carp to an elephant.

A veterinarian is qualified to treat all animals, but a doctor is limited to only treating one species.
